channel.title: http on Sade Smith
channel.description: Recent content in http on Sade Smith

item.title: Overview of the HTTP/2 Protocol
item.description: Introduction In 2015, the HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) underwent a major revision when HTTP/2 became officially standardized. With the protocol’s last major update being in 1999 (HTTP/1.1), it was a much needed upgrade. The previous version of the protocol, HTTP/1.1, proved to posses numerous limitations for most modern websites. The average HTTP requests per page have risen dramatically overtime as well as page size. Simply put, HTTP/1.1 was developed to handle websites of its time and not of today.
